_header: Now is the twelfth day I-come
_description: An Epiphany carol — seventeen 5-line stanzas (aaabb), and burden: ‘Reges de saba venient / Aurum tus myrram offerent’

BodEngPoete1.First Lines:
Now ys þe thwelthe day cumþe fadyr & þe son to
                    geder is won…
BodEngPoete1.Last Lines:
…& of owre synnys we ask remyssion& grace in
                    heune to haue a place
BodEngPoete1.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Songs and Carols from a manuscript…of the Fifteenth
                Century.
Percy Society
         23. London: Richards, 1847: 46-8.
Hotten,  John Camden,
                                (alias Joshua Sylvester). 
             A Garland of Christmas Carols, Ancient and Modern.
         London, 1861 [listed as  “Sylvester”  in
            IMEV]: 9.

CamStJohn259.First Lines:
Now ys þe xii day comfadyr & son to gydyr
                    wone…
CamStJohn259.Note:
Fourteen stanzas of four lines plus bob, aaabb; lacks
                    burden.
CamStJohn259.Editions:
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 82-4; 1977, 73-4.
James,  Montague Rhodes,  and  G. C. Macaulay, eds.  
             “Fifteenth Century Carols and Other Pieces.” 
             Modern Language Review
         8 (1913): 68-87: 77-9.

BLSl2593.First Lines:
Now is the twelthe day icomeThe fader & sone togeder arn
                    nome…
BLSl2593.Last Lines:
…Bryng vs to the blysse þat is so fre In fere&
                    send vs a good newe yere
